title: INTERSPEECH_2006_21_abs

sentences.text: In this paper , we discuss language model adaptation methods given a word list and a raw corpus .
In this situation , the general method is to segment the raw corpus automatically using a word list , correct the output sentences by hand , and build a model from the segmented corpus .
In this sentence-by-sentence error correction method , however , the annotator encounters grammatically complicated positions and this results in a decrease of productivity .
In this paper , we propose to concentrate on correcting the positions in which the words in the list appear by taking a word as a correction unit .
This method allows us to avoid these problems and go directly to capturing the statistical behavior of specific words in the application .
In the experiments , we used a variety of methods for preparing a segmented corpus and compared the language models by their speech recognition accuracies .
The results showed the advantages of our method .

summary: In this paper , we discuss language model adaptation methods given a word list and a raw corpus . In this situation , the general method is to segment the raw corpus automatically using a word list , correct the output sentences by hand , and build a model from the segmented corpus . In this sentence-by-sentence error correction method , however , the annotator encounters grammatically complicated positions and this results in a decrease of productivity . In this paper , we propose to concentrate on correcting the positions in which the words in the list appear by taking a word as a correction unit . This method allows us to avoid these problems and go directly to capturing the statistical behavior of specific words in the application . In the experiments , we used a variety of methods for preparing a segmented corpus and compared the language models by their speech recognition accuracies . The results showed the advantages of our method .

Predicate-segment_automatically_using.label: segment automatically using
Predicate-segment_automatically_using.description: The predicate 'segment automatically using' indicates that the subject (a process or methodology) employs an automated approach to divide or partition the object (typically, a text or data structure), resulting in distinct segments.

Predicate-encounters.label: encounters
Predicate-encounters.description: The predicate 'encounters' indicates a situation where the subject and object interact or come into contact with each other. This interaction can be physical, cognitive, emotional, or any other type of encounter that involves a connection between two entities.

Predicate-propose_to_concentrate_on.label: propose to concentrate on
Predicate-propose_to_concentrate_on.description: To propose to concentrate on something means to suggest or intend to focus one's attention and efforts on a particular aspect, issue, or problem. This predicate indicates an intention to prioritize or emphasize the object in question, often implying a commitment to explore it further.

Predicate-allows_us_to_avoid.label: allows us to avoid
Predicate-allows_us_to_avoid.description: The predicate 'allows us to avoid' indicates a means of circumventing or sidestepping certain obstacles, difficulties, or challenges. It suggests that the subject (in this case, This method) provides an opportunity for something or someone to bypass or overcome these issues.

Predicate-use.label: use
Predicate-use.description: To employ or apply something (e.g. an approach, technique, resource) to achieve a specific goal or outcome.

Predicate-is_described_as.label: is described as
Predicate-is_described_as.description: The predicate 'is described as' connects the subject to an object that provides a characterization or interpretation of the subject. It indicates that the subject is represented, explained, or understood in terms of the object, which can be a concept, idea, model, or description.

Predicate-is_applied_to.label: is applied to
Predicate-is_applied_to.description: The predicate 'is applied to' indicates a relationship where the subject (a concept, approach, or technique) is used or put into practice with respect to the object (a specific context, situation, or entity). This connection implies that the subject has been adapted, implemented, or utilized in some way for the purpose of addressing, resolving, or understanding the object.

Predicate-concentrate.label: concentrate
Predicate-concentrate.description: To focus one's attention or mental effort on a specific aspect, idea, or task, often to achieve clarity, understanding, or mastery.

Predicate-allows.label: allows
Predicate-allows.description: The predicate 'allows' indicates a permission or authorization for the subject to engage in an action or state described by the object. It implies that the subject has the capacity, right, or freedom to perform or exist in the manner specified by the object.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject (a specific concept or word) is related to its more general counterpart, which is represented by the object. This relationship suggests that the subject can be subsumed under or categorized within the scope of the object.
